headline: Marc Sausa Named PRNEWS' People of the Year, Capping Breakout Year for Berk Communications
summary: PRNEWS has named Marc Sausa, a Senior Vice President at Berk Communications—a MikeWorldWide subsidiary—to its 2025 People of the Year Awards in the Agency Leadership category. The annual honor spotlights visionary communications professionals advancing the PR industry through creativity, cultural relevance, and measurable business impact.

headline: Mary Franck Joins Hyperquake to Help Shape the Future of Immersive Experiences
summary: Hyperquake, the independent creative strategy, branding, and experience design agency, is very proud to announce the immediate addition of Creative Director Mary Franck to its Experiences Team. The full-time staff addition was confirmed by Hyperquake's President and Chief Operating Officer Melissa Wheat Kelly.

headline: Defense stocks gain on Lutnick comments, AMD & IBM, Cracker Barrel
summary: Investors are watching defense stocks, like Lockheed Martin (LMT), Northrop Grumman (NOC), and General Dynamics (GD), following comments from Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick. They are also eyeing AMD (AMD) and IBM (IBM), as well as Cracker Barrel (CBRL) during Tuesday's session. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: IBM Teams Up With AMD For Quantum Computing Push. Stocks Rise.
summary: IBM and Advanced Micro Devices will partner on advancing quantum computing technology, the companies announced Tuesday.  Both IBM stock and shares of AMD were higher in early Tuesday trading.  IBM and AMD will team up to "develop next-generation computing architectures" that will rely on a combination of quantum computers and high-performance computing.

headline: 2 Reasons AMD Stock Is Rising Today
summary: AMD and IBM announced plans to develop new computing architectures based on a combination of AMD’s technology such as central processing units and graphics processing units, or CPUs and GPUs, and IBM’s quantum computers.  The companies didn’t announce any new products in the press statement.  AMD stock was climbing 2.4% to $167.30 in premarket trading.

raw.headline: 2 Reasons AMD Stock Is Rising Today

The companies didn’t announce any new products in the press statement.  AMD stock was climbing 2.4% to $167.30 in premarket trading.

headline: IBM-AMD Alliance Targets Drug Discovery, Climate Modeling With Quantum Supercomputers
summary: International Business Machines Corp. (NYSE:IBM) and Advanced Micro Devices Inc. (NASDAQ:AMD) are partnering to advance quantum-centric supercomputing, combining IBM’s quantum hardware and software expertise with AMD’s strength in high-performance computing and AI acceleration. The collaboration, announced Tuesday, is aimed at building scalable, open-source platforms that integrate quantum and classical systems to solve problems beyond the reach of traditional computing. headline: IBM and AMD Join Forces to Build the Future of Computing
summary: Today, IBM (NYSE: IBM) and AMD (NASDAQ: AMD) announced plans to develop next-generation computing architectures based on the combination of quantum computers and high-performance computing, known as quantum-centric supercomputing.
